Class PlayerContext

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.view.PlayerContext
public class PlayerContext extends Object
Represents the client-side context of a player, tracking their current game phase and connection status.

The PlayerContext is responsible for managing transitions between different game phases (joining, building, checking, adventure, end), and for updating the associated UI controller when a phase change occurs.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PlayerContext()
    Constructs a new PlayerContext and sets the initial phase to JoiningPhaseData.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentPhase

      public GamePhaseData getCurrentPhase()
      Returns the current GamePhaseData associated with the player.
      Returns:
      the current phase data

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks whether the player is currently alive (i.e., connected and active).
      Returns:
      true if the player is alive, false if killed or disconnected

    • kill

      public void kill(MainCLI mainCLI)
      Marks the player as no longer active and shuts down the CLI interface.

      This is typically called upon disconnection, crash, or elimination.

      Parameters:
      mainCLI - the CLI interface to shut down

    • setJoiningPhase

      public void setJoiningPhase()
      Sets the game phase to JoiningPhaseData and notifies the current controller (if any).
